text: Production of Brucella melitensis Omp16 protein fused to the Human Interleukin 2 in Lactococcus lactis MG1363 toward developing Lactococcus-based vaccine against Brucellosis. The use of food-grade bacterium Lactococcus lactis as a new cell factory is a promising alternative expression system for production of desired protein. The current study is conducted to clone, express and purify Omp16-IL2 fusion protein antigen. The Omp16-IL2 fusion gene was designed and cloned into pGH plasmid with appropriate restriction sites and sub cloned in pAMJ2008 expression vector (Bioneer A/S (Horsholm, Denmark) digested with the same enzymes. The purified recombinant constructed pAMJ2008-Omp-IL2 was introduced into L.lactis subsp. cremoris MG1363 by electro transformation. Finally the expression and purification of Omp16-IL2 fusion protein was investigated. This study reports the construction of recombinant Lactococcus lactis expressing Omp16-IL2 fusion protein as an oral Lactococcus-based vaccine compared to commonly used live attenuated vaccines for future studies against Brucellosis.
